content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Regex to find julia code blocks
    regex = r"```julia\n((?:.|\n)*?)```"
    
    matches = collect(eachmatch(regex, md))
    
    if isempty(matches)
        return ""
    end
    
    # Remove the triple backticks and join all code blocks together with newline
    joined_code = reduce((a, b)->a*"\n"*b.captures[1], matches) do a, b
        b.captures[1]
    end
    
    return joined_code
end
```
This function first finds all code blocks in the markdown document using a regular expression (`regex`). It then reduces the list of matches into one big string where each code block is joined by a newline character. This function assumes that there will be at least one code block in the input markdown and does not check for this case.
